oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Ursula Greene, 1976 August 12, excerpt 03
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Ursula Greene, conducted on 12 August 1976 by Jane King as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. Greene discusses women's fashion during the 1890s and explains that they had to wear long dresses so that they would not show their ankles. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Greene, Ursula Daimwood, 1876-1979--Interviews
